title: World Straits
description: Famous straits and narrow waterways around the world

questions.question: The Strait of Gibraltar connects the Atlantic Ocean to which sea?
The Strait of Hormuz is a critical chokepoint for the global oil trade. It connects the Persian Gulf to which body of water?
The Strait of Malacca, one of the world's busiest shipping lanes, lies between the Malay Peninsula and which island?
The Bosphorus Strait divides which city between Europe and Asia?
The Strait of Magellan is located at the southern tip of which continent?
The English Channel, the strait between England and France, is known in French as what?
The Strait of Messina separates mainland Italy from which island?
Drake Passage, one of the roughest waterways in the world, lies between South America and which continent?
The Bering Strait separates Alaska from which country?
The Dardanelles Strait, known in ancient times as the Hellespont, is located in which country?
The Strait of Taiwan separates Taiwan from mainland China. Approximately how wide is it at its narrowest point?
The Torres Strait lies between Australia and which nearby island nation?
The Strait of Dover is the narrowest part of the English Channel. Approximately how wide is it?
The Strait of Bonifacio separates the islands of Corsica and Sardinia. These islands belong to which two countries?
The Strait of Mozambique separates Madagascar from the southeastern coast of which continent?
